sub_title: All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.
summary:
All-round assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. 

My qualities:

- Maintaining many (international) contacts at a working level.
- Making good use of my profound knowledge of English and German which I master at a 
  translator level.
- Being able to manage and organize groups (30 - 40 persons).
- Planning and executing travel programmes.
- Providing a broad (non financial) administrative support with logistic tasks as well.
- Organizing and arranging matters or events on a project basis.
- Doing research.
- Providing a collaborating and / or steering role.
- Being able to work abroad regularly.

When I am able to apply my keywords in a job I feel good and will be able to work at full speed.
My jobs at the Rijksdienst voor het Wegverkeer, Rijksuniversiteit Groningen, Hanzehogschool Groningen or as a tour guide are very clear examples of that. Starting from day one I felt completely at ease every time.

My specialties are Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. I have a profound knowledge of these countries.
I am able to apply my competences and knowledge to a maximum as a tour leader.

projects:
[{'title': 'Delivering a lecture on Dutch colonists in Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Belarus and Ukraine during the Second World War', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'The title of my lecture was: -
"Nederlandse Oostlandboeren e.a. in Estland, Letland, Litouwen, Wit-Rusland en Oekraïne 1941-1945."
I told the audience about the subject with a power point presentation. Preparations took several days. The subject is only known to a very small group of Dutch people. Little has been written about the subject.
The lecture was conducted in Dutch and was held in the Veenkoloniaal Museum in Veendam. The audience amounted to app. 60 people.

The Netherlands Antilles (1978/79)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}]}, {'title': 'Co-organization of an exhibition about Latvian-Dutch relations in the 19th and 20th centuries in Mencendorfs nams Museum in Riga, Latvia. ', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'I was asked to take part in this project by the director of Veenkoloniaal Museum in Veendam, the Netherlands. The exhibition covered e.g. trade, consular and diplomatic relations. The parts regarding the Latvian and Dutch consuls and diplomats of both countries during the Inter War Period were worked on by me. I provided details about the lives and work of the consuls and diplomats, Furthermore we all found pictures of the buildings in which the consuls and the diplomats worked. These were all exhibited and described. The physical creation of the exhibtion in the museum took part in November 2018. It was ran until March 2019.

The project / exhibition was a part of the framework of the proclamation of Latvian independence on 18 November 1918 and initiated by the Veenkoloniaal Museum.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hendrik Andries', 'last_name': 'H.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Veenkoloniaal Museum Veendam'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Elise van Ditmars', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Staff of the Mencendorfs nams Muzejs', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Radio recording of Estonian classical and contemporary music', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Invited by Radio Parkstad in Veendam within the framework of an exhibition of Estonian needlework in the Veenkoloniaal Museum (Oct. 2015 - Jan. 2016) and on my initiative I compiled a selection of contemporary and classical Estonian music. My preparations took several days.
On 27 August and on 16 July 2015 I worked in the studio of the radio station. Together with Mr. Theo Mooijman (co-presenter) and Mr. Sander Cinjee (technician) we recorded the music during four hours. Mr Mooijman and I introduced the music and told something about the musicians. Mr. Mooijman asked me questions about Estonia as well.
The recordings were broadcast on Mondays 5, 12, 19 October and 2 November 2015 between 20.00 and 21.00 hours.
I compiled a list of 51 songs and musical pieces. Furthermore I compiled 14 pages containing information about the artists and the songs. The range of music includes works of great Estonian composers like Arvo Pärt, Veljo Tormis, Lepo Sumera, Heino Eller, Raimond Valgre and Eduard Tubin. Contemporary music included works by eg. Ewert and the Two Dragons, Maarja Liis Ilus, Sandra Nurmsalu, Evelin Samuel, Ott Lepland, Siiri Sisask, Curly Strings, Ivo Linna and Tõnis Mägi. Of course the great opera singer Georg Ots is included.
It is without a doubt that it was the first time in Dutch history that four hours of Estonian music were broadcast by a Dutch radio station.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Theo Mooijman en Sander Cinjee', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Radio recording of Latvian contemporary music', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': "Invited by Radio Parkstad in Veendam within the framework of the 'LATVIA DAYS' in Veendam and on my initiatieve, I compiled a selection of contemporary Latvian music. On 12 November (and 4 December next again) I worked in the studio of the radio station. Together with Mr. Theo Mooijman (moderator) and Mr. Sander Sinjee (technician) we recorded the music during two hours. I introduced the music and told something about the musicians. Mr. Mooijman asked me questions about Latvia and the musicians.
The recording was broadcast on 19 November 2013. Is was the first in a sequel of five successive Tuesdays on which Radio Parkstad broadcast Latvian contemporary and classical music. Three recordings were made with Mr. Jan Sleumer (2) and Mrs. Anouk Bāliņš (1). The latter sung live Latvian music and played her guitar.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}]}, {'title': 'Organization of the celebration of the 20th anniversary of the Netherlands-Baltic Association', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Together with members of the board I organized this event, encompassing  speeches, lectures, presentations, Baltic poetry, literature, music, singing, and catering. Several meetings were held for discussions about the programme, location, coordination, organization, logistics, volunteers and the budget. App. 100 people attended the very succesfull celebration on 17 November 2012. Among them members of the Association, Baltic ambassadors, consuls and other e.g. Estonian, Latvian,and Lithuanian guests. The key note speaker especially flew in from Estonia.
Overall coordination was in my hands.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}]}, {'title': 'Freelance assistance to the embassy of the Republic of Lithuania in The Hague', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'In 2008, at the request of the embassy I contacted the municipalities of Hoogezand-Sappemeer and Vlagtwedde (Groningen province) about possible cooperation with the Lihuanian town of Raseiniai. E.g. I visited an elderman of Hoogezand-Sappemeer and discussed the matter after which I reported to the embassy. The mayor of H-S, officials and businessmen of the municipality in the meantime have had contacts with Lithuania and several delegations visited each other.
In 2009, on my initiative, an existing exhibition of Lithuanian ex-librisses was held in Groningen. It was organized by the Lithuanian Cultural Centre in the Netherlands and was first on display in Rotterdam.
In 2009 and 2010 I carried out research regarding contacts between Northern Dutch transporters and Lithuania, export of horticultural products by a Dutch firm etc. Furthermore I have listed several travel agencies that organize travels to Lithuania and I listed several schools providing business education in the Northern Netherlands. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Profit and non profit.'}]}, {'title': 'Refereeravond', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'description': 'For the readership "Integral Youth Policy" at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences I organized a "Refereeravond" with the reader.
During this evening the reader shared knowledge and developments with teachers, policy makers and researchers in the field of education and youth. The logistical organization (incl. catering, reservations of rooms, invitations among others) was in my hands in cooperation with the reader. Preparations took nearly half a year. 
Over one hundred people were invited and many of them attended the succesful meeting.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'John', 'last_name': 'de Jonge', 'name': None, 'headline': 'All-round (international) assistant with working experience in the fields of secretarial support, administration, organization, doing research and as an experienced international tour guide. Its business would have been the trade in superfluous commodities like paper etc. I contacted many businesses by phone and internet to get information and impressions. Next to that I studied relevant literature. All the relevant information I put into a report that I handed over to the principal.
